pages.text: The hopper item filter gives you up to five slots to define blocks or items for a hopper to accept (or not accept).$(br2)Filters use "fuzzy" matching, so custom data like NBT or damage values are ignored. As long as a block or item type matches the filter, it will be accepted (or not, depending on the mode).

pages.title: Recipe
pages.text: By default, the filter is set to "include" mode, meaning that only items in the filter will be accepted. You can toggle the mode by shift-right-clicking in the air while holding the filter.

pages.title: Defining a filter
pages.text: Note that the filter's texture changes slightly when it has items defined vs. when it is empty.

pages.title: Adding to a hopper
pages.text: Filterable hoppers have an extra slot on the right side, marked by a small filter icon. Place the filter in this slot to enable filtering.

pages.title: Filtering in action
pages.text: Items being transferred from a chest to a filtered hopper. Notice that the wool is not being transferred, as it is not in the filter.
